hackathon-description-text: Multidisciplinary teams will have 24 hours to learn from mentors, brainstorm, and generate solutions to some of the world’s most pressing problems. Depending upon the problem, proposed solutions can involve hardware, software, art, text, and other materials. The 3 challenge categories are: Pollution, Renewable Energy, Conservation Technology.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Alumni Engagement & Government Relations Associate / The GREEN Program
Director of Technology / The GREEN Program
Digital Makerspace Community Manager / Conservation X Labs
Climate Scientist / The Science Museum of Virginia
Assistant Professor of Sociology / VCU Sociology
VCU Director of Sustainability / VCU Office of Sustainability
Associate Professor / VCU Chemical and Life Science Engineering

hackathon-eligibility: Individuals (over 18 years in age) and enrolled in a college or university
hackathon-requirements:
The three topics are: Pollution, Conservation Tech, and Renewable Energy.
Find All Challenges

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: 1st Place Prize: The Green Program Scholarship

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Please select this if you are competing a challenge under the Pollution category.
Please select this if you are competing a challenge under the Conservation Tech category.
Please select this if you are competing a challenge under the Renewable Energy category.

hackathon-description-header: An innovation-focused event where students from all majors develop solutions to real-world environmental challenges while learning from mentors to brainstorm and generate solutions.
